* The etymology of "cortese" is ultimately from the Germanic word *kurtijan*, meaning "to be courteous". However, the Italian word "cortese" was borrowed from the French word "courtois", which is derived from the Germanic word. * The etymology of "mentre" is uncertain, but it is thought to be derived from the Latin word "mens", meaning "mind". * The etymology of "disio" is ultimately from the Latin word "desiderium", meaning "desire". However, the Italian word "disio" is derived from the Old French word "desir", which is derived from the Latin word.
